newsitem.title: USA: Merrill had record net, revs in Q4.
newsitem.headline: Merrill had record net, revs in Q4.

text.p: Merrill Lynch & Co Inc said its net income and revenues both reached record levels in the fourth quarter, capping a record year at the firm.
Merrill earned $445 million in the quarter, a figure aided by a $155 million pre-tax gain on the sale of a partial interest in Bloomberg LP.

The company also posted a $40 million pre-tax charge in connection with the resolution of Olympia & York's bankruptcy, a case that affected Merrill's long-term sublease at the World Financial Center in New York.
Merrill's fourth quarter net revenues rose to a record $3.4 billion, up 29 percent from year-ago levels. The firm achieved increases in all its major revenue categories.
It said commission revenues totalled $967 million versus $847 million in 1995 and principal transactions revenues rose to $744 million from $566 million.
Investment banking revenues climbed to $517 million from $370 million and asset management and portfolio service fees rose to $601 million from $494 million.
Merrill's effective tax rate declined in the quarter to 34.1 percent from 37.1 percent a year earlier due to lower state taxes and tax benefits associated with its international operations.

Total assets in Merrill's worldwide private client accounts reached a record $839 billion at the end of 1996, up $60 billion versus the end of the third quarter and up $136 billion from the end of 1995.
Assets under management at the firm's asset management business also set a record, reaching $234 billion at year-end, up $21 billion for the quarter and $38 billion for the year.
